enum.label:
Phase valid indication is qualified by previous 2 samples. Setting works in two scenarios:
                        * When phase valid is a pulse with edge transitions synchronous to ckvd16.
                        * When phase valid is a pulse of more than one ckvd16 period with rising edge synchronous to ckvd16 and asynchronous falling edge.
Phase valid indication is not qualified by previous 2 samples. Setting works only when phase valid is a pulse with edge transitions synchronous to ckvd16 clock.

DLYCANCRS.desc:
Cancellation path coarse delay
                    
                    Coarse tune latency for cancellation path in relation to the addition path (when modulating). The final delay is the sum of coarse delay and fine delay.

DLYCANFINE.desc:
Cancellation path fine delay
                    
                    Fine tune latency for cancellation path in relation to the addition path (when modulating). The final delay is the sum of coarse delay and fine delay.

DLYADD.desc:
Addition path delay
                    
                    Field specifies additional latency on the modulation data towards antenna.

FCDEMCLK.desc:
Bitmask to enable additive terms in INL correction
                    
                    See implementation spec for details

enum.label: ckvd16 clock used for update upper and lower DWA DEM
ckvd64 clock used for update upper and lower DWA DEM

FCDEMUPD.desc: Configures dynamic element matching of fine code

enum.label: Default: Update both DWAs always at rising edge of selected clock
SDM[1] (this value depends on DEM for SDM)

TDCINL.desc:
Bitmask to enable additive terms in INL correction
                    
                    See implementation spec for details

PHINIT.desc: Decides if there is known phase relationship between reference clock and RF

SDMOOVR.desc:
SDM output code override
                     
                    When [MISC1.SDMOOVRCTL] = EN, field value overrides the 3-bit SDM output to DCO.
                    When [MISC1.SDMOOVRCTL] = DIS, SDM takes 8-bit input and modulates the 3-bit output to DCO.

KIPREC.desc:
FIR integral gain precision
                    
                    When numerical value of [KI] is lower than 16-1/256, high precision can be enabled. 
                    FIR loop filter gets reinitialized with the current value whenever:
                    - DLO moves from calibration operation to closed-loop state.
                    - DLO moves from open-loop operation to closed-loop operation.
                    - DLO is in closed-loop operation and there is a change on loop control set. See [DLOCTL0.LOOPUPD].

KI.desc:
FIR integral gain
                    
                    Field sets the integral gain in the FIR loop filter. 
                    
                    FIR_KI = pi^2 * f3db^2 / (FREF * KDCO * DF^2)
                    
                    where DF is the desired damping factor. Lower damping factor gives lower phase margin in the loop. Typically damping factors in the range 0.75 to 1 is used. Note that equations above become more accurate when DF > 1. 
                    
                    Encoding is given by [KIPREC] setting. Examples:
                    
                    When [KIPREC] = 0:
                    
                    0x000: KI  = 0 
                    0x001: KI  = 1 
                    0xFFF: KI = 4095
                    
                    When [KIPREC] = 1:
                    
                    0x000: KI = 0x0.00 = 0.0
                    0x001: KI = 0x0.01 = 0.00390625 
                    0x002: KI = 0x0.02 = 0.0078125
                    0x004: KI = 0x0.40 = 0.25 
                    0x008: KI = 0x0.80 = 0.5
                    0xFF0: KI = 0xF.F0 = 15.9375
                    0xFFF: KI = 0xF.FF = 15.99609375
                    
                    FIR loop filter gets reinitialized with the current value whenever:
                    - DLO moves from calibration operation to closed-loop state.
                    - DLO moves from open-loop operation to closed-loop operation.
                    - DLO is in closed-loop operation and there is a change on loop control set. See [DLOCTL0.LOOPUPD].

KP.desc:
FIR proportional gain 
                    
                    Field sets the proportional gain in FIR loop filter.
                    
                    FIR_KP = 2*pi* f3db / KDCO
                    
                    Encoding is <14.0u>:
                    0x0000: Minimum proportional gain
                    0x3FFF: Maximum proportional gain
                    
                    FIR loop filter gets reinitialized with the current value whenever DLO moves from calibration or open-loop operation to closed-loop operation.

CNT.desc:
Phase error discard count
                    
                    When phase error discarding is enabled, FIR loop filter does not update if:
                    
                    abs(phase error) > PHEDISC_THR / 64
                    
                    Update loop if this happens for CNT consecutive REFCLK periods.
                    
                    Set [DLOCTL1.PHEDISC] = EN to enable phase error discarding.

THR.desc:
Phase error discard threshold
                    
                    When phase error discarding is enabled, FIR loop filter does not update if:
                    
                    abs(phase error) > PHEDISC_THR / 64
                    
                    Update loop if this happens for [CNT] consecutive REFCLK periods.
                    
                    Set [DLOCTL1.PHEDISC] = EN to enable phase error discarding.

OFF.desc:
Reference phase offset
                    
                    Field initializes phase offset between CKVD and reference clock.
                    
                    Encoding of field is <0.8u>.
                    
                    Examples:
                    0x40: 25% of CKVD clock period
                    0x80: 50% of CKVD clock period
                    0xC0: 75% of CKVD clock period

PHELOLCNT.desc:
Phase error lock loss count
                    
                    Loss of lock is indicated when abs(phase error) >  PHELOLTHR / 2:
                    
                    - for PHELOLCNT consecutive periods of REFCLK . 
                    - and loop filter fincode overflows or underflows. 
                    
                    When either of these conditions occur [DLOEV.LOL] flag gets set in REFCLK domain, and synthesizer IRQ to modem is asserted. See [DLOCTL1.PLLMON] for further description.

PHELOLTHR.desc:
Phase error lock loss threshold
                    
                    Loss of lock is indicated when abs(phase error) > PHELOLTHR / 2:
                    
                    - for [PLLMON0.PHELOLCNT] consecutive periods of REFCLK . 
                    - and loop filter fincode overflows or underflows. 
                    
                    When either of these conditions occur [DLOEV.LOL] flag gets set in REFCLK domain, and synthesizer IRQ to modem is asserted. See [DLOCTL1.PLLMON] for further description.

FCTHR.desc:
Fine code threshold
                    
                    Field sets two symmetric thresholds, with encoding <7.8u>:
                    FCLWTHR =  {FCTHR, 8'b0}
                    FCUPTHR  =  {8'b0111111 - FCTHR), 8'b1}
                    
                    The PLL monitor compares the final 15-bit fine code sent to DCO and SDM to these thresholds:
                    
                    When fine code > FCUPTHR, [DLOEV.FCABVTHR] flag gets set in REFCLK domain.
                    When fine code < FCLWTHR, [DLOEV.FCBLWTHR] flag gets set in REFCLK domain.
                    
                    In both cases synthesizer IRQ to modem is asserted. See [DLOCTL1.PLLMON] for further description.
                    
                    Internal_note:
                    * default value should be 0 so that detector is effectively disabled for any fine code.

PHELOCKCNT.desc:
Phase error lock count
                    
                    Declare lock for PLL if:
                    
                    abs(phase error) < PHELOCKTHR / 64
                    
                    for PHELOCKCNT*4 consecutive periods of default REFCLK. When this happens [DLOEV.LOCK] flag gets set in REFCLK domain, and synthesizer IRQ to modem is asserted. See [DLOCTL1.PLLMON] for further description.

PHELOCKTHR.desc:
Phase error lock threshold
                    
                    Declare lock for PLL if:
                    
                    abs(phase error) < PHELOCKTHR / 64
                    
                    for [PHELOCKCNT] *4 consecutive periods of default REFCLK.When this happens [DLOEV.LOCK] flag gets set in REFCLK domain, and synthesizer IRQ to modem is asserted. See [DLOCTL1.PLLMON] for further description.

SCHEME.desc:
Scheme
                    
                    Field sets the modulation scheme of the DLO

enum.label:
No connect
                        
                        Modulator output does not add to frequencey control word from PLL.

In-loop modulation with FREF resolution
                        
                        MOD_RES = FREF / (DIVIDER/2) / 2^(15+[CANPTHGAIN])
                        
                        [DIV.RATIO] determines DIVIDER configuration. Scheme only supports closed-loop operation.
                        
                        Internal_note:
                        Agama Narrowband mode equivalent.

In-loop modulation with FRF resolution
                        
                        MOD_RES = FRF / 2^(21+[CANPTHGAIN])
                        
                        Internal_note:
                        Coherent narrowband TX support added for LRF.
                        Symbol-mapping must account for mod inversion.

2-point modulation with FRF resolution
                        
                        MOD_RES = FRF / 2^(21+[CANPTHGAIN])
                        
                        Scheme supports both open -and closed-loop operation. Scheme allows wider modulation bandwiths than INLOOP_MOD_FRF.
Use generic 3 symbol shaper defined by SHAPECFG* registers.
Use piecewise linear PSK shaper defined by SHAPECFG* registers.

CANPTHGAIN.desc:
Cancellation path gain
                    
                    The cancellation phase is scaled by a configurable gain, which effectively sets the modulator frequency control word resolution. To calculate the resolution, use the binary value of this field in equations in [SCHEME].

SHPGAIN.desc:
Shape gain
                    
                    Field sets the scaling factor for shape elements in [DTX0.*] - [DTX5.*]. Both the scaling factor and shape element values are generated offline for a certain frequency deviation.
                    
                    INTERNAL_NOTE:
                    * Please refer to https://spsemea.itg.ti.com/sites/lpw/proj/CC26xx/Architecture/Radio%20System/cc26xx_modem_spec.doc for how the [SHPGAIN] and shape elements together defines the frequency deviation for different modes.
                    * The scaling factor is is really as follows:
                      X1 = DIV_BY_4
                      X2 = DIV_BY_2
                      X4 = DIV_BY_1
                      X8 = DIV_BY_0P5
                      Will not update to reflect this as the matlab gain output === SHPGAIN.

INTPFACT.desc:
Interpolation factor
                    
                    Field sets the interpolation factor of the shape filter.
                    
                    INTERNAL_NOTE:
                    Please refer to https://spsemea.itg.ti.com/sites/lpw/proj/CC26xx/Architecture/Radio%20System/cc26xx_modem_spec.doc for more detailed description.

FOFF.desc:
Frequency Offset
                    
                    Field configures the optional intermediate frequency (IF) used in TX or RX.
                    
                    IF = FRF / 2^(21+[CANPTHGAIN])  * FOFF
                    
                    Encoding is <12.0s>.

VALLSB.desc:
PLLM0 value
                    
                    Field sets the desired output frequency of the PLL, FRF, using the default PLL reference frequency, according to:
                    
                    M-value = FRF * (DIVIDER/2) / FREF0
                    
                    Field encoding is <12.18u>
                    
                    [PRE0.PLLDIV0] determines FREF0. [DIV.RATIO] determines DIVIDER.
                    
                    Internal_note:
                    * 2.1 GHz =< FRF * (([DIV.RATIO]//2) <= 2.8 GHz

VALMSB.desc:
PLLM0 value
                    
                    Field sets the desired output frequency of the PLL, FRF, using the default PLL reference frequency, according to:
                    
                    M-value = FRF * (DIVIDER/2) / FREF0
                    
                    Field encoding is <12.18u>
                    
                    [PRE0.PLLDIV0] determines FREF0. [DIV.RATIO] determines DIVIDER.
                    
                    Internal_note:
                    * 2.1 GHz =< FRF * (([DIV.RATIO]//2) <= 2.8 GHz

VALLSB.desc:
PLLM1 value
                    
                    Field sets the desired output frequency of the PLL, FRF, using the default PLL reference frequency, according to:
                    
                    M-value = FRF * (DIVIDER/2) / FREF1
                    
                    Field encoding is <12.18u>
                    
                    [PRE0.PLLDIV1] determines FREF1. [DIV.RATIO] determines DIVIDER.
                    
                    Internal_note:
                    * 2.1 GHz =< FRF * (([DIV.RATIO]//2) <= 2.8 GHz

VALMSB.desc:
PLLM1 value
                    
                    Field sets the desired output frequency of the PLL, FRF, using the default PLL reference frequency, according to:
                    
                    M-value = FRF * (DIVIDER/2) / FREF1
                    
                    Field encoding is <12.18u>
                    
                    [PRE0.PLLDIV1] determines FREF1. [DIV.RATIO] determines DIVIDER.
                    
                    Internal_note:
                    * 2.1 GHz =< FRF * (([DIV.RATIO]//2) <= 2.8 GHz

VAL.desc:
Coarse SAR m-value
                    
                    Field sets the desired output frequency of the PLL, FRF,  during coarse SAR, according to:
                    
                    VAL = FRF * (DIVIDER/2) / COARSE_CALIB_FREF 
                    
                    Field encoding is <16u>. 
                    
                    [PRE2.CRSCALDIV] determines COARSE_CALIB_FREF. [DIV.RATIO] determines DIVIDER.

Mid SAR m-value
                    
                    Field sets the desired output frequency of the PLL, FRF, during mid SAR, according to:
                    
                    VAL = FRF * (DIVIDER/2) / MID_CALIB_FREF  
                    
                    Field encoding is <16u>. 
                    
                    [PRE2.MIDCALDIVLSB] and [PRE3.MIDCALDIVMSB]  determines MID_CALIB_FREF. [DIV.RATIO] determines DIVIDER.

LOAD.desc:
Load value for 16-bit REFCLK prescaler
                    
                    The REFCLK prescaler is used when [DLOCTL0.LOOPUPD] bit-2 = 1.

LRFDRFE.DLOCTL0.desc:
DLO Control Register 0
                
                This register contains dynamic signals, and can be updated when DLO is out of reset.
                
                Internal_note:
                * Consult with LRFDLO implementation specification to see classification of static, pseudo-static, and dynamic inputs.

TDCSTOP.desc:
TDC stop configuration
                    
                    During TDC calibration the value specifies the pulse duration used to calculate the TDC gain as number of CKVD periods (2 / FDCO). Value effectively sets the resolution of the FW-calculated [CAL2.KTDCINV].
                    
                    Otherwise, the TDC stop delay is programmable in units of CKVD clock periods. The stop delay is either static or randomly decided per reference clock period. The latter is referred to as TDC stop-time dithering.
                    
                    000: TDC stops when flop 0 becomes 1. During TDC calibration pulse length is 1 CKVD period.
                    001: TDC stops when flop 1 becomes 1. During TDC calibration pulse length is 2 CKVD periods.
                    010: TDC stops when flop 2 becomes 1. During TDC calibration pulse length is 3 CKVD periods.
                    011: TDC stops when flop 3 becomes 1. During TDC calibration pulse length is 4 CKVD periods.
                    1xx: TDC stops when a randomly chosen flop becomes 1. Do not use for TDC calibration.

DTSTXTAL.desc:
XTALBAW DTST interface control
                    
                    Configure DTST interface in [DTST.*] when interface is disabled.

LOOPUPD.desc:
Loop update control
                    
                    The PLL frequency and loop dynamics are controlled through a set of configurations of coarse and mid codes, TCD gain, reference clock divider, and feedback divider(PLLM). Registers for PLLM and reference clock dividers are duplicated to support REFCLK dithering, and/or loop BW gearing. These are set 0 and set 1. It is also possible to update all configurations at certain events to move the frequency around in the tuning range, and adjust the loop bandwidth at the same time. Basically:
                    - bit-0: Static control set select (manual switch-FW)
                        0 : select control set 0.
                        1 : select control set 1.
                    - bit-1: Dithering select (automatic switch-LFSR)
                        0: Functionality unused.
                        1: LFSR single bit output is used to select control set according to bit-0 select rules. Average F_REFCLK to be used in Ki equation is the harmonic mean, F_REFCLK = 2/[1/F_REFCLK0 + 1/F_REFCLK1].
                    - bit-2: Timer select (automatic switch-prescaler)
                        0: Functionality unused.
                        1: On every [REFDIV.LOAD] REFCLK event DLO toggles the control set select. FW can update the one not used.
                    
                    There are restrictions on legal settings and transitions.
                    
                    Internal_note:
                    See the implementation specification for explicit details and rules when using this register.

enum.label:
Halt DLO FSM after DCO frequency span measurement 
                        
                        When DLO and RFE runs KDCO estimation, RFE must compute KDCO from the frequency span, and calculate loop filter settings to use before lock aquisition.
Close the loop to aquire phase lock, i.e. phase 3 of calibration routine.

Halt DLO FSM after TDC calibration measurement 
                        
                        When DLO and RFE runs TDC calibration, RFE must use calibration measurement to calculcate [CAL2.KTDCINV].
Start KDCO estimation, i.e. phase 2 of calibration routine.

RSTN.desc:
DLO reset
                    
                    DLO active low reset. The DLO has several static inputs that all needs to be set prior to releasing reset. 
                    
                    Internal_note:
                    * Consult with LRFDLO implementation specification to see classification of static, pseudo-static, and dynamic inputs.

enum.label: DLO is not held in reset

LRFDRFE.DLOCTL1.desc:
DLO Control Register 1
                
                This register contains dynamic signals, and can be updated when DLO is out of reset.
                
                Internal_note:
                * Consult with LRFDLO implementation specification to see classification of static, pseudo-static, and dynamic inputs.

LFSYNCATGRSHFT.desc:
Loop filter synchronization at gear shift
                    
                    Feature prevents loop step response when loop bandwidth gets updated in presence of non-zero phase error. The feature needs to be enabled before updating the loop control set. It will trigger only for the first loop control update.

enum.label: Disable loop synchronization at gear shift
Enable loop synchronization at gear shift

LFSYNCATPEAK.desc:
Loop filter synchronization at phase error peak
                    
                    Feature can be used to reduce the frequency overshoot/undershoot, and reduce phase error transient that follows from known and controlled aggressors in the loop, like PA-pulling. The requirement for usage is that PLL is locked and phase error is close to zero, then RFE enables the aggressor that injects a step response in the loop. Following this, RFE enablse the feature and when time derivate of phase error is ~0, the loop filter accumulator will be pulled as close to finecode as possible without causing a step in finecode.

enum.label: Disable loop filter synchronization at phase error peak
Enable loop filter synchronization at phase error peak

PHEADJ.desc:
Phase error adjust control
                    
                    Feature can be used to correct MTDC samples that are +/- 30 codes in closed-loop operation. This is identified using fixed thresholds of +/- 0.25 in phase error magnitude, and hence it must only be used when phase error has stabilized around 0. It must be disabled during phase error transients.

DTSTCKVD.desc:
CKVD DTST interface control
                    
                    Configure DTST interface in [DTST.*] when interface is disabled.

PHEDISC.desc:
Phase error discarding control
                    
                    Feature discards large phase errors from propagating into the loop filter. [PHEDISC.*] configures the behavior.

PLLMON.desc:
PLL monitor control
                    
                    The PLL monitor detects the following PLL states in the variable clock domain:
                    - Lock (static)
                    - Loss of lock (dynamic)
                    - Fine code above threshold (static)
                    - Fine code below threshold (static)
                    
                    The monitor signals the occurence of these conditions to the reference clock domain. This domain does positive edge detection for lock and loss-of-lock events, and synchronizes the threshold events. The IRQ to modem is high whenever reference clock domain events are high.
                    
                    The lock and loss-of-lock flags are cleared individually in the reference clock domain. Disable the PLL monitor to reset the all event flags in the variable clock domain. PLL Lock and Loss of Lock flags are automatically cleared in the variable clock domain when transitioning from open-loop to closed-loop operation.
                    
                    To clear Lock and Loss of Lock flags using this field, the DLO must operate in closed-loop mode, and a new value must be stable for at least 2 REFCLK periods.
                    
                    Keep PLL monitor disabled during the calibration states.

IIR.desc:
IIR control
                    
                    Do not enable during lock aquisition.

MOD.desc:
Modulator control
                    
                    Enable of MODISF (Modulator's Interpolating Shaping Filter)

MIDCODE.desc:
Mid code override
                    
                    When [MIDCTL] equals EN, field value overrides the DCO mid code, which sets the DCO mid row and column control. Special encoding:
                    MIDCODE[5:4]:
                    00: DCO mid row = 15
                    01: DCO mid row = 7
                    10: DCO mid row = 3
                    11: DCO mid row = 1
                    
                    DCO mid column = 15-to_integer(MIDCODE[3:0])

CRSCODE.desc:
Coarse code override
                    
                    When [CRSCTL] equals EN, field value overrides the DCO coarse control. This is required during debug and when coarse calibration is skipped, or we want to use other values during startup of ALO. Encoding is <4.0u>:
                    
                    0xFF: min frequency
                    …
                    0x00: max frequency

FINECODE.desc:
Fine code override
                    
                    When [DCOOVR0.FINECTL] equals EN, field value overrides the integer part of DCO fine code . 
                    
                    Encoding is <7.0u>:
                    0x00: Min
                    ...
                    0x7F: MAX

SDMICODE.desc:
SDM input code override
                    
                    When [DCOOVR0.SDMICTL] equals EN, field value overrides the fractional part of DCO fine code to SDM. Encoding is <0.8u>:
                    0x00: 0
                    ...
                    0x7F: 0.99609375
                    
                    The fractional value is added to the integer part.

LRFDRFE.DTST.desc:
Data Test
                
                Configuration register for DTST interface that allows streaming of PLL signal values to [LRFDS2R:*], and to select signal to read in [DTSTRD.DATA].
                Configuration must happen when [DLOCTL0.DTSTXTAL] and [DLOCTL0.DTSTCKVD] are 0.

VARTGLDLY.desc:
Variable domain toggle delay
                    
                    Field sets delay on toggle launch compared to data launch. CLK equals launch clock for signal selected in [SIG]. It can be eiter CKVD16 or reference clock.

enum.label: Toggle lags data by 0 CKVD16 periods.
Toggle lags data by 1 CKVD16 periods.
Toggle lags data by 2 CKVD16 periods.
Toggle lags data by 3 CKVD16 periods.
Toggle lags data by 4 CKVD16 periods.
Toggle lags data by 5 CKVD16 periods.
Toggle lags data by 6 CKVD16 periods.
Toggle lags data by 7 CKVD16 periods.

REFTGLDLY.desc:
Reference domain toggle delay
                    
                    Field sets delay on toggle launch compared to data launch. CLK equals launch clock for signal selected in [SIG]. It can be eiter CKVD16 or reference clock.

enum.label: Toggle lags data by 0 HFXT/BAW periods.
Toggle lags data by 1 HFXT/BAW periods.

TRNSEQ.desc:
Trainer sequence control
                    
                    When trainer sequence is enabled, dtst data will not reflect [SIG] configuration. Instead, it will toggle between 0x5555 and 0xAAAA for every update uof the data specified by [SIG].

SIG.desc:
Signal Configuration 
                    
                    Selects which signal to route to DTST data port.  Any change to MSB may cause modem to detect false toggle. Hence, the first sample must  be discarded in modem after a change to MSB.
                    
                    Whenever signal po_tdc_stop_dly_sel is sampled, discard the first three samples.
                    
                    All bits in dtst_data vector originates from the same reference clock edge, unless otherwise noted.

enum.label:
dtst_data = u_fsm/po_dtst_fsm_ferr_mag 
                        
                        Format is14.2u. The signal is only updated for frequency measurements that affect the calibration result.

dtst_data :
                        
                        [15] : u_pll/phase_error[16]
                        [14:0] : u_pll/phase_error[14:0]  
                        
                        Format is 5.11s. Phase error wraps if if too large.

dtst_data :
                        
                        [15:14] : po_tdc_stop_dly_sel
                        [13] : u_pll/phase_error[16] 
                        [12:9]: u_pll/phase_error[11:8]
                        [8:0] : u_pll/var_phase[14: 6]
                        
                        [13:9] : phase error. Format is 2.3s.
                        [8:0]   : variable phase. Format is 4.5u.

dtst_data :
                        
                        [15:14] : po_tdc_stop_dly_sel
                        [13] u_pll/phase_error[16]
                        [12:0]: u_pll/phase_error[12:0]
                        
                        [13:0] : phase_error. Format is 3.11s.

dtst_data :
                        
                        [15:14] : po_tdc_stop_dly_sel
                        [13] : u_pll/pi_tdc_msb_error
                        [12] : u_pll/pll_loop_update
                        [11] : (u_pll/po_ckvd48_pllmon_lock  XOR u_pll/po_ckvd48_pllmon_lol)
                        [10:0]:  u_pll/pi_tdc_data
                        
                        Note that [12:11] are samples from previous reference clock edge.

dtst_data : 
                        
                        [15] : u_mpx/freq_can[16]
                        [14:0] : u_mpx/freq_can[14:0]
                        
                        Format is 1.15s. This field holds how much phase DTX adds to DCO per reference frequency. This is a slice of the signals that goes to u_pll which is 3.18s. Hence, wrapping can occur.

dtst_data :
                        
                        [15:7] : finecode(13:5)
                        [6:0] : phase_error(13:7)
                        
                        Phase error is 3.4s and finecode gets 7.3u when it gets post-processed as (14:7) + (15)*64.

dtst_data :
                        
                        [15:7] : finecode(13:5)
                        [6:1] : phase_error(12:7)
                        [0] : lfsync event
                        
                        phase error is 2.4s and finecode gets 7.3u when it gets post-processed as (14:7) + (15)*64.

LRFDRFE.DLOEV.desc: DLO FSM State and IRQ Flags

LOL.desc:
Loss of lock
                    
                    [PLLMON0.PHELOLCNT] and [PLLMON0.PHELOLTHR] configures the behaviour.

STATE.desc:
DLO FSM state
                    
                    Internal_note:
                    See implementation specification for details.

DATA.desc: Data selected by [DTST.SIG] when the DTST interface is enabled.

VAL.desc:
Value
                    
                    Sum of inverter delays calculated by HW at the end of the TDC calibration. The number of delays summed is controlled by [CAL0.TDCAVG] and [DLOCTL0.TDCSTOP]. FW uses value to calculate [CAL2.KTDCINV].

FLAGS.desc:
Flags
                    
                    The flags provide indication of which TDC measurement, if any, that are incorrect. Updated during calibration routine on every DLO event. It shall only be read after the last DLO event during TDC calibration given that [MISC0.TDCCALENHCTL] = 1.

LOGVAL.desc:
Logarithmic output value
                    
                    Logaritmic value of [MATHACCELIN.VAL].

DIV3.desc:
Divider output value
                    
                    Calculation performed: [MATHACCELIN.VAL]/3
                    
                    Supports input values <= 46, higher values are saturated.

CPTSRC.desc:
Event capture source
                    
                    Index selects the corresponding event from RFE event bus, [EVT0.*] and [EVT1.*].

CPTCTL.desc:
Counter capture control
                    
                    Upon selected capture event, the counter value will be captured into [TIMCAPT.*].

CNTRCTL.desc:
16-bit counter control
                    
                    The counter will continue from its current value.

TIMCTL.desc:
16-bit timer control
                    
                    It will generate a timer interrupt after [TIMPER.*] timer ticks. Note that the internal timer value is not readable from the RFE. If this is needed the counter should be used instead of the timer.

enum.label: Disable timer and clear internal timer value

VAL.desc: Configurable 16 bit period that can be used for either the timer or the counter. In timer context, when timer value reach the timer period (i.e. it expires) a TIMER_IRQ event will occur, and the timer will restart from zero (until the timer is manually disabled). In counter context, a COUNTER_IRQ event will occur when the counter is equal to or higher than the period value.

ADC divider control

TXPH0DIV.desc:
TX 0-phase divider control

C1BEPEAKB.desc: Restart C1BE peak B search (32 symbols = 128 samples)

C1BEPEAKA.desc: Restart C1BE peak A search (32 symbols = 128 samples)

C1BEADVANCE.desc: Speed up correlator autocopy with one sample

C1BESTALL.desc: Slow down correlator autocopy with one sample

C1BEROT.desc: Correlator rotate command to shift reg B

C1BECOPY.desc: Copy contents of shift reg A into shift reg B

PBEDAT.desc: New data from PBE received in [PBEDATIN0.*] register.

PBECMD.desc: New command from PBE received in [PBECMDIN.*] register.

RFEDAT.desc: New data from RFE received in [RFEDATIN0.*] register.

FIFOWR.desc: A write to the modem FIFO (via [FIFOWR.*] register), probably by CPE.

COUNTER.desc: Counter value reached in local timer

RFECMD.desc: New command from RFE received in [RFECMDIN.*] register.

CLKEN4BAUD.desc: Clock enable event at 4 times baud rate

TIMER.desc: Timer period expired in local timer

MDMAPI.desc: New command from PBE has been written in [API.*] register.

COHRFSM.desc: COHRFSM event happens when the coherent demodulator FSM has finished a command (FOFF or IEEE command)

COHRBUF.desc: COHRBUF event happens whenever the coherent demodulator IQ buffer is filled

COHRUPD.desc: COHRUPD event happens whenevever the coherend demodulator has a new correlation value available

S2RSTOP.desc: S2R module has written to the STOP_ADDRESS register

SWQUFALSESYNC.desc: Sync word qualifier rejected sync due to bit errors (happens if a correlator event was incorrect due to noise).

SWQUSYNCED.desc: Sync word qualifier detected sync word

CLKENBAUDF.desc: Clock enable event at flushed baud rate

FIFORVALID.desc: Modem FIFO has valid data so a new word can be read from it, via [FIFORD.*].

FIFOWREADY.desc: Modem FIFO is ready for more data so a new word can be written to it, via [FIFOWR.*] register.

CLKENBAUD.desc: Clock enable event at baud rate

GPI1.desc: External input event line GPI1 from **IOC**

GPI0.desc: External input event line GPI0 from **IOC**. (Also, when loopback mode is enabled in [DEMDEBUG.LOOPBACKMODE], this input line represents the symbols fed to the demodulator's decode stage).

FIDCESTRDY.desc: Fine DC estimate value from FIDC is ready

C1BECMBANY.desc: C1BE correlator AB combined, any peak detect: (abs(corr A) > thr A) and (abs(corr B) > thr B). Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BECMBNEG.desc: C1BE correlator AB combined, negative peak detect: (corr A < -thr A) and (corr B < -thr B). Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BECMBPOS.desc: C1BE correlator AB combined, positive peak detect: (corr A > thr A) and (corr B > thr B). Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BECANY.desc: C1BE correlator C, any peak detect: abs(corr C) > thr C. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BECNEG.desc: C1BE correlator C, negative peak detect: corr C < -thr C. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BECPOS.desc: C1BE correlator C, positive peak detect: corr C > thr C. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEBANY.desc: C1BE correlator B, any peak detect: abs(corr B) > thr B. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEBNEG.desc: C1BE correlator B, negative peak detect: corr B < -threshold B. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEBPOS.desc: C1BE correlator B, positive peak detect: corr B > threshold B. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEAANY.desc: C1BE correlator A, any peak detect: abs(corr A) > thr A. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEANEG.desc: C1BE correlator A, negative peak detect: corr A < -thr A. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEAPOS.desc: C1BE correlator A, positive peak detect: corr A > thr A. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

TOPSMPDREQ.desc: Requests power-down for TOPsm core. If the TOPsm has an ongoing memory access, the hardware will safely gate the clock after the transaction has completed.

VAL.desc: Diverse status, error, report bits from MCE. Readable as well in PBE. Controlled by software.

OFFSET.desc: Frequency Offset from MCE, controlled by software

PAYLOADIN.desc: FIFO write port. The actual port size is configurable in [FIFOWRCTRL.*]

PAYLOADOUT.desc: FIFO read port. The actual port size is configurable in [FIFORDCTRL.*]

enum.label: The [FIFOWR.*] register is used for write access

WORDSZWR.desc: Actual bits in every word write access

enum.label: The [FIFORD.*] register is used for read access

WORDSZRD.desc: Actual bits in every word read access

VAL.desc: Data to send to PBE. Writing to this register will trigger an event in the PBE, and the command value written here will be readable in [LRFDPBE:MCEDATIN0.*] register.

OVERFLOW.desc: FIFO overflow error. If this flag is asserted the modem FIFO must be re-initialized with [INIT.TXRXFIFO] to clear it. Note that re-initializing will flush the FIFO.

ALMOSTFULL.desc: FIFO is almost full. Asserts when the FIFO fill level is above the almost full threshold.

ALMOSTEMPTY.desc: FIFO is almost empty. Asserts when the FIFO fill level is below the almost empty threshold.

UNDERFLOW.desc: FIFO underflow error. If this flag is asserted the modem FIFO must be re-initialized with [INIT.TXRXFIFO] to clear it.

RXVALID.desc: A full data word is valid and can be read in [FIFORD.*] register read port.

TXREADY.desc: The [FIFOWR.*] register write port is ready to receive a data word.

VAL.desc: Data to send to RFE. Writing to this register will trigger an event in the RFE, and the command value written here will be readable in [LRFDRFE:MCEDATIN0.*] register.
Command to send to RFE. Writing to this register will trigger an event in the RFE, and the command value written here will be readable in [LRFDRFE:MCECMDIN.*] register.
Data to send to PBE. Writing to this register will trigger an event in the PBE, and the command value written here will be readable in [LRFDPBE:MCEDATIN0.*] register.
Command to send to PBE. Writing to this register will trigger an event in the PBE, and the command value written here will be readable in [LRFDPBE:MCECMDIN.*] register.

SEL.desc: Select one internal event and route to the PBE for usage in the event-unit there

SEL1.desc: Selects one source to send to the systimer output event 1

SEL0.desc: Selects one source to send to the systimer output event 0

SEL2.desc: Selects one source to send to the systimer output event 2

QBRANCHEN.desc: Enables Q component data branch in ADCDIG

IBRANCHEN.desc: Enables I component data branch in ADCDIG

REPS.desc: Number of preamble repetitions of preamble pattern

SOFTSYMBOL.desc: Soft symbol {-7..+7} used when [MODCTRL.SOFTTXENABLE] is enabled.

RATEWORD.desc: Rate word (bits [20:5]). The 5 LSBs of the 21-bit rate word are defined in [BAUDPRE.EXTRATEWORD] register.

ALIGNVALUE.desc: Align value for timebase after sync

EXTRATEWORD.desc: Extended Rate Word (bits [4:0]). These are the 5 LSBs extending the 16 MSBs configured in [BAUD.RATEWORD] to form a 21 bit rate word.

FECSELECT.desc: Forward Error Correction Selection. Used for some signal-wiring in modulator and demodulator.

enum.label: Bluetooth LE coded long range compatible FEC

CMIXNFINE.desc: 3 LSB bits of the cmix8192. Use for fine frequency tuning.

CMIXN.desc: Signed factor of mixer phasor, Fmix=n*Fs/1024 , where n in range [-512, 511]

CDCTGAINMA.desc: Gives the gain mantissa of the CDC P/Q tracker

CDCTGAINEX.desc: Gives the gain exponent of the CDC P/Q tracker

enum.label: Do not enable collision detect and restart feature
Enable collision detect and restart feature
Output of the FEXB, as selected by [DEMFEXB0.OUT2SRCSEL] register

CHFIBW.desc: Select bandwidth (cut-off frequency) of demodulator channel filter

MLSERUN.desc: Enable maximum likelihood sequence estimation (MLSE) desicions

MAFCGAIN.desc: Set gain in MAFC. Multiplies symbols with 2^N before symbol recovery stage

enum.label: Perform both estimation and correct timing

STIMESTONLY.desc: Only perform symbol timing error estimation in STIM, without doing timing correction

enum.label: Perform both estimation and correct timing

STIMTEAPERIOD.desc: Symbol timing error accumulator period (4 to 128 symbols) in STIM

STIMTEAGAIN.desc: Symbol timing error accumulator gain in STIM

PDIFLINPREDEN.desc: Enable linear predictor in PDIF at CORDIC output

PDIFDESPECK.desc: Enable despeckler in PDIF at CORDIC output

PDIFIQCONJEN.desc: Conjugate the complex I/Q signal in PDIF

PDIFLIMITRANGE.desc: Limit range on maximal PDIF output, i.e. instantaneous frequency sample

CDCOVERRIDE.desc: CDC FIFO Write pointer initialisation setting override

BDE2DVGA.desc:
DVGA settings for BDE2. The DVGA control for BDE2 is shared with the RFE in its [LRFDRFE:GAINCTRL.BDE2DVGA] register.
                    Software should determine who uses them. Please note that if both processors attempt to control it, the resulting setting will be the two settings ORed together.

BDE1FILTMODE.desc: BDE1 Filter only mode. When enabled, BDE1 lp filters in signal path, but no decimation occurs.

BDE1DVGA.desc:
DVGA settings for BDE1. The DVGA control for BDE1 is shared with the RFE in its [LRFDRFE:GAINCTRL.BDE1DVGA] register. 
                    Software should determine who uses them. Please note that if both processors attempt to control it, the resulting setting will be the two settings ORed together.

GAINFACTOR.desc:
Gain factor to compensate for unequal gains between the I and Q signal paths in the analog RF front-end.
                    The compensation is done by scaling the I path amplitude (no compensation of Q path).
                    The gain factor is given as an unsigned number in the range [0,255] corresponding to gain factor range [0,2],
                     where value 128 gives gain factor 1.0 (no gain). Any gain compensation is applied in a stage after the phase compensation.

PHASEFACTOR.desc:
Phase factor to compensate for unorthogonal I and Q signals.
                    The phase factor is given as a signed number in the range [-128,127] corresponding to phase factor range [-0.5, 0.496], 
                    where the phase factor can be calculated as phase_factor = tan(phase_error).
                    This gives an available phase error compensation range of [-26.6, 26.4] degrees.

DSBUDELAY.desc:
Output delay from sample buffer, as offset between write and read pointers.
                    The buffer can hold up to 256 samples. Delay of 0 means maximum.

DSBUAVGLENGTH.desc: Length for moving average of the newest DSBU samples. The buffer can hold up to 512 samples. Length of 511 is maximum.

Use the manual compensation value in [DEMFIFE1.*] for initialization

C4.desc: Filter coefficient c4. The matched filter will have unity gain when the sum of all coefficients c0 to c8 equals 512.

MASKB.desc:
Mask for correlator B to select the correlator length to use. 
                    The number specifies number of nibbles (i.e. 4-bit block, which typically corresponds to one symbol) 
                    of the correlator holding the oldest samples that will be ignored in computations. 
                    When set to zero, the full 128 sample (=32 symbol) correlator length will be used.

MASKA.desc:
Mask for correlator A to select the correlator length to use.
                    The number specifies number of nibbles (i.e. 4-bit block, which typically corresponds to one symbol) 
                    of the correlator holding the oldest samples that will be ignored in computations. 
                    When set to zero, the full 128 sample (=32 symbol) correlator length will be used.

COPYCONF.desc: Control auto copy of contents from corr A to corr B

THRESHOLDB.desc: Correlation threshold value for correlator B

THRESHOLDA.desc: Correlation threshold value for correlator A

PARLOADCONF.desc: Configuration to control peak event generation (applies to correlators A, B, D, E)

enum.label: Trigger peak event on all peaks above threshold
Trigger peak event only if peak is highest in correlator since search start

PEAKCONF.desc: Configuration to control peak event generation (applies to correlators A, B, D, E)

enum.label: Trigger peak event on all peaks above threshold
Trigger peak event only if peak is highest in correlator since search start
Trigger peak event for combined highest peak search for corr "A and B" and "D and E" in pairs

THRESHOLDC.desc: Correlation threshold value for correlator C (corr C is A+B concatenated)

Spare register for use by firmware

Spare register for use by firmware

enum.label: Set the C1BE in special early/late mode

SOFTPDIFFMODE.desc: Enable Soft PDIFF mode for RX

FEC5TERMINATE.desc: Goes into termination mode in 5Mbps TX FEC. This bitfield is not valid anymore.

WORD.desc: 16 bit preamble word pattern. The LSB is transmitted first

P15C0.desc:
Downsampler P[15:0]. Sample rate of the output signal: Fs_out = Fs_in * P/Q. 
                    The hardware requires the resampling factor P/Q to be in the range [1/4, 1], 
                    i.e. only down-sampling with a factor in the range [1,4] is supported.

Q15C0.desc:
Downsampler Q[15:0]. Sample rate of the output signal: Fs_out = Fs_in * P/Q. 
                    The hardware requires the resampling factor P/Q to be in the range [1/4, 1],
                     i.e. only down-sampling with a factor in the range [1,4] is supported.

CPTSRC.desc: Selects bit number from event bus for a counter capture. Event number in range 0 to 63

CPTCTL.desc: Enable counter capture on event.  Upon a capture event, the counter value will be captured in [TIMCAPT.*] register.

CNTRCLR.desc: Clear counter value in [TIMCNT.*] to zero when this bit is set to 1.

CNTRCTL.desc: Enable 16-bit counter when set to 1. The counter will continue from its current value.

TIMSRC.desc: Select timer tick source for timer

TIMCTL.desc:
Enable 16-bit timer. It will generate a timer interrupt after [TIMPER.*] timer ticks.
                    Note that the internal timer value is not readable from the MCE. If this is needed the counter should be used instead of the timer.

enum.label: Will disable timer and clear internal timer value

VAL.desc: Programmable counter increment. For each counter event: [TIMCNT.*] + 1).

Configurable 16 bit period that can be used for either the timer or the counter. 
                    In timer context, when timer value reach the timer period (i.e. it expires) a TIMER_IRQ event will occur,
                    and the timer will restart from zero (until the timer is manually disabled). 
                    In counter context, a COUNTER_IRQ event will occur when the counter is equal to or higher than the period value.
16 bit counter value that can be read by the MCE
Input data, which we shall find the number of 1's in
Number of 1's in the COUNT1IN register

Shows which sync word had a peak event and was selected for sync word qualification test.
                    This is to tell which sync word was detected when radio operates in receive mode with dual sync word search.

Reads as '1' when the sync word specified by [DEMSWQU1.SWSEL] has passed qualification, otherwise '0'.
                    Note that the sync word qualification is only performed on MSB portion of the reference vector, 
                    as specified in [DEMSWQU0.REFLEN] register.

SWA15C0.desc:
Sync word A bits 15:0. Sync words shorter than 32 bits must be stored as most signicant bits of sync word A.
                    The sync word is expected to be transmitted/received in LSB to MSB order.

SWA31C16.desc:
Sync word A bits 31:16. Sync words shorter than 32 bits must be stored as most significant bits of sync word A.

SWB15C0.desc:
Sync word B bits 15:0. Sync words shorter than 32 bits must be stored as most significant bits of sync word B.
                    The sync word is expected to be transmitted/received in LSB to MSB order.

SWB31C16.desc:
Sync word B bits 31:16. Sync words shorter than 32 bits must be stored as most significant bits of sync word B.
                    The sync word is expected to be transmitted/received in LSB to MSB order.

VAL.desc: Value of the HDIS output, FRAC_en ticks

IIRBW.desc: Bandwidth of IIR register in coherent modem

IIRGAIN.desc: Gain of IIR in coherent modem

BETA.desc: Proportional gain for the feedback to NCO in the coherend demodulator

ALPHA.desc: Integration gain for the feedback toNCO in the coherent demodulator

REFROT.desc: Rotation of the reference vector, unit is symbols

REFLEN.desc: Length of the reference vector used for the correlator

VAL.desc: Frequency offset estimate output of the coherent correlator FSM, resoltuion f_baud/2^6

VAL.desc: Fine frequency offset estimate of coherent demodulator fine frequency offset tracking loop. Resolution f_baud/2^10

LRFDMDM.BAUDCOMP.desc: Baudrate adjustment setting to compensate for system clock source mismatch

SCALEVAL.desc: Scale factor to apply to CDC FIFO pointer distance

LRFDMDM.DEMCMIX2.desc: Config for second complex mixer (inside coherent demodulator)

LRFDMDM.DEMFB2P2.desc: Configures loop parameters for fb2pll module

AVGVAL.desc: Current sum of samples between write and read pointers

REFB.desc: Reference symbol B (the DEMPHAC1.phac_sym_len+1 lower bits are in use)

REFA.desc: Reference symbol A (the DEMPHAC1.phac_sym_len+1 lower bits are in use)

PHACTRLEN.desc: Training sequence length (in multiples of 4. Ex: phac_tr_len = 2 => 8 symbols)

PHASEINCR.desc: The expected phase change per sample, unit is 32*MOD_INDEX

CORRVALUEC.desc: Correlation value combined correlator (corr C is corr A+B combined)

PEAKCONFG.desc: 0: Trigger peak event on all peaks above threshold

PEAKCONFCF.desc: Configuration to control peak event generation for correlators C and F

enum.label: Trigger peak event on all peaks above threshold
Trigger peak event only if peak is highest in correlator since search start
Trigger peak event for combined highest peak search for corr C and F

MASKE.desc: Mask for correlator E to select the correlator length to use. The number specifies number of nibbles (i.e. 4-bit block, which typically corresponds to one symbol) of the correlator holding the oldest samples that will be ignored in computations. When set to zero, the full 128 sample (=32 symbol) correlator length will be used.

MASKD.desc: Mask for correlator D to select the correlator length to use. The number specifies number of nibbles (i.e. 4-bit block, which typically corresponds to one symbol) of the correlator holding the oldest samples that will be ignored in computations. When set to zero, the full 128 sample (=32 symbol) correlator length will be used.

enum.label: Neither correlator D or E is in use
Connect correlators in series (D -> E), D has input from C1BE input
Connect correlators in parallel, D and E  has input from C1BE input
Correlator E is not in use
Connect correlators in series (D -> E), D has input from corr B output
Correlator E is not in use, D has input from corr B output

THRESHOLDE.desc: Correlation threshold value for correlator E

THRESHOLDD.desc: Correlation threshold value for correlator D

THRESHOLDG.desc: Correlation threshold value for correlator G (corr G is corr A+B+D+E combined)

THRESHOLDF.desc: Correlation threshold value for correlator F (corr F is corr D+E combined)

CORRVALUEF.desc: Correlation value combined correlator (corr F is corr D+E combined)

CORRVALUEG.desc: Correlation value combined correlator (corr G is corr A+B+D+E combined)

C1BECOPY2.desc: Copy contents of shift reg D into shift reg E

C1BEPEAKG.desc: Restart C1BE peak G search (corr G is corr C+F combined, which is corr A+B+D+E combined = 128 symbols = 512 samples)

C1BEPEAKDE.desc: Restart C1BE peak D and E search

C1BEPEAKF.desc: Restart C1BE peak F search (corr F is corr D+E combined = 64 symbols = 256 samples)

C1BEPEAKE.desc: Restart C1BE peak E search (32 symbols = 128 samples)

C1BEPEAKD.desc: Restart C1BE peak D search (32 symbols = 128 samples)

C1BEDLOADED.desc: C1BE correlator D loaded (by auto-copy function)

C1BEGANY.desc: C1BE correlator G, any peak detect: abs(corr G) > thr G. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEGNEG.desc: C1BE correlator G, negative peak detect: corr G < -thr G. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEGPOS.desc: C1BE correlator G, positive peak detect: corr G > thr G. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BECMBDEANY.desc: C1BE correlator DE combined, any peak detect: (abs(corr D) > thr D) and (abs(corr E) > thr E). Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BECMBDENEG.desc: C1BE correlator DE combined, negative peak detect: (corr D < -thr D) and (corr E < -thr E). Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BECMBDEPOS.desc: C1BE correlator DE combined, positive peak detect: (corr D > thr D) and (corr E > thr E). Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEFANY.desc: C1BE correlator F, any peak detect: abs(corr F) > thr F. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEFNEG.desc: C1BE correlator F, negative peak detect: corr F < -thr F. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEFPOS.desc: C1BE correlator F, positive peak detect: corr F > thr F. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEEANY.desc: C1BE correlator E, any peak detect: abs(corr E) > thr E. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEENEG.desc: C1BE correlator E, negative peak detect: corr E < -threshold E. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEEPOS.desc: C1BE correlator E, positive peak detect: corr E > threshold E. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEDANY.desc: C1BE correlator D, any peak detect: abs(corr D) > thr d. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEDNEG.desc: C1BE correlator D, negative peak detect: corr D < -thr D. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

C1BEDPOS.desc: C1BE correlator D, positive peak detect: corr D > thr D. Event occurs one sample after actual peak.

Base value used to set timer0 for when to start Reception.

RXREPEATNOK.desc: Rule for what to do after packets with CRC error or address mismatch.

Send finite length packet from FIFO
Send data from PATTERN (Assumes infinite packet length)
Do nothing. RCL handles the TXF_FCMD.
Retry the TX FIFO after TX_DONE.
Deallocate the TX FIFO after TX_DONE.

Do not calibrate the PLL before the operation starts. If the PLL is already running, it is not stopped.

SINGLE.desc: Only one shall be high of SINGLE, IFSPERIOD or RFINTERVAL.

IFSPERIOD.desc: Only one shall be high of SINGLE, IFSPERIOD or RFINTERVAL.

Enable NESB features. Checking of SEQ/PID, auto ack, auto retransmit, adr matching etc.

PBE_GENERIC_RAM.CRCVAL0.desc: NESB feature. CRC value (last two bytes if more than 2 CRC bytes) of last successfully received packet with syncWord0.

STOPAUTO.desc: PTX may attempt to receive an Ack packet and then execute automatic retransmission if the reception failed due to sync timeout or wrong CRC or full RX fifo. PRX may execute automatic acknowledgement transmission and then return to sync search.

enum.label: Always stop automatic response regardless of the NOA bit. PTX end operation. PRX restarts sync search.
If the transmitted or received NOA bit is One, stop automatic response.
If the transmitted or received NOA bit is Zero, stop automatic response.
Never stop automatic response regardless of the NOA bit. PTX executes automatic retransmission until MAXRETRANS counter is reached. PRX transmits an ACK packet and then restarts sync search.

PID.desc: NESB Sequence Number or packet ID.

enum.label: The status is not valid. Any packet is viewed as new.
The status is valid. Only packets with sequence number and CRC different from the previous one are accepted.

PBE_GENERIC_RAM.CRCVAL1.desc: NESB feature. CRC value (first two bytes if more than 2 CRC bytes) of first successfully received packet with syncWord1.

STOPAUTO.desc: PTX may attempt to receive an Ack packet and then execute automatic retransmission if the reception failed due to sync timeout or wrong CRC or full RX fifo. PRX may execute automatic acknowledgement transmission and then return to sync search.

enum.label: Always stop automatic response regardless of the NOA bit. PTX end operation. PRX restarts sync search.
If the transmitted or received NOA bit is One, stop automatic response.
If the transmitted or received NOA bit is Zero, stop automatic response.
Never stop automatic response regardless of the NOA bit. PTX executes automatic retransmission until MAXRETRANS counter is reached. PRX transmits an ACK packet and then restarts sync search.

PID.desc: NESB Sequence Number or packet ID.

enum.label: The status is not valid. Any packet is viewed as new.
The status is valid. Only packets with sequence number and CRC different from the previous one are accepted.
